Course Offered to: B.Tech. post 4 semesters (students from 3rd year), M.Tech., and Ph.D.
Course Description: The course covers the tools, legal entities, fundraising methods, team formation, and venture launch strategies for entrepreneurs. It is divided into three modules: Explore, Identify, and Execute. Module 1 focuses on understanding entrepreneurial dilemmas and business opportunities. Module 2 introduces lean startup methodologies and bootstrapping techniques. Module 3 covers growth strategies, market analysis, and financing options.

Mandatory: Get an insight of the practical challenges and opportunities involved in getting a venture off the ground and the rewards it offers
Desirable: Understand the importance of quick prototyping and the ability to pivot a venture based on early customer feedback.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Get an insight of the practical challenges and opportunities involved in getting a venture off the ground and the rewards it offers
Course Outcomes.CO2: Understand the importance of quick prototyping and the ability to pivot a venture based on early customer feedback.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Visualize the advantages and pitfalls of the various fundraising options available
Course Outcomes.CO4: Mastering tools such as Business Model Canvas to demonstrate proficiency for fundraising, team building, and marketing the startup idea.

Utilizing strategies of cost leadership, differentiation, and focus in new ventures | Industry Analysis tools like Porter's 5 forces and PESTEL Model

Understanding Financing Options | Funding and Growing a Business
